title: Getting Started with rrlmgraph
code: install.packages("rrlmgraph")  # For optional LLM chat integration: install.packages("ellmer")

title: Getting Started with rrlmgraph
text: build_rrlm_graph() accepts path R project – package, scripts folder, Shiny app – returns rrlm_graph object. function: Detects project type (package / scripts / Shiny app) Parses every .R file function nodes via AST analysis Resolves CALLS, IMPORTS, TEST edges nodes Fits TF-IDF embeddings semantic similarity
code: library(rrlmgraph)  # Point to any R project directory -- here we use a small demo package graph <- build_rrlm_graph(proj_dir, verbose = TRUE) #> Detecting project at /tmp/Rtmp15UXpI/mypkg_demo #> Parsing 3 R file(s) #> Warning: No function nodes found in /tmp/Rtmp15UXpI/mypkg_demo. #> Empty graph returned. #> Building CALLS edges #> Building IMPORT edges #> Building TEST edges #> Assembling igraph #> Computing PageRank #> Embedding nodes with method 'tfidf' #> Computing semantic similarity edges (threshold 0.7) #> Done in 0.33s -- 0 nodes, 0 edges

title: Getting Started with rrlmgraph
text: plot() draws force-directed layout coloured node type: steelblue – user-defined functions grey70 – package / imported functions seagreen3 – test files lightyellow – nodes
code: summary(graph) #> IGRAPH ae7fb00 DNW- 0 0 --  #> + attr: project_name (g/c), project_root (g/c), project_type (g/c), #> | r_version (g/c), build_time (g/n), build_at (g/c), embed_method #> | (g/c), embed_model (g/x), cache_path (g/c), name (v/c), node_type #> | (v/c), file (v/c), line_start (v/n), line_end (v/n), signature (v/c), #> | complexity (v/n), pagerank (v/n), embedding (v/x), weight (e/n), #> | edge_type (e/c) print(graph) #> IGRAPH ae7fb00 DNW- 0 0 --  #> + attr: project_name (g/c), project_root (g/c), project_type (g/c), #> | r_version (g/c), build_time (g/n), build_at (g/c), embed_method #> | (g/c), embed_model (g/x), cache_path (g/c), name (v/c), node_type #> | (v/c), file (v/c), line_start (v/n), line_end (v/n), signature (v/c), #> | complexity (v/n), pagerank (v/n), embedding (v/x), weight (e/n), #> | edge_type (e/c) #> + edges from ae7fb00 (vertex names): plot(graph)

title: Getting Started with rrlmgraph
text: query_context() performs relevance-guided BFS relevant nodes returns token-budgeted context window ideal LLM prompts. assembled context string – ready paste system prompt:
code: ctx <- query_context(   graph,   query = "How does the data preparation step work?",   budget_tokens = 400L,   verbose = TRUE )  # Nodes selected for the context window ctx$nodes #> character(0)  # Number of tokens used ctx$tokens_used #> [1] 0 cat(ctx$context_string)

title: Getting Started with rrlmgraph
text: chat_with_context() assembles context sends LLM. Supported providers via ellmer package: call automatically logs query, nodes used, response excerpt .rrlmgraph/task_trace.jsonl inside project root. trace used update_task_weights() boost frequently-referenced nodes future relevance scoring.
code: # OpenAI (default) -- requires OPENAI_API_KEY answer <- chat_with_context(   graph,   "How does prepare_data() ensure clean input?" ) cat(answer)  # GitHub Models Marketplace -- requires GITHUB_PAT answer <- chat_with_context(   graph,   "What does fit_model() return?",   provider = "github",   model    = "gpt-4o-mini" )  # Local Ollama -- no API key needed answer <- chat_with_context(   graph,   "Summarise the prediction pipeline.",   provider = "ollama",   model    = "llama3.2" )  # Anthropic Claude -- requires ANTHROPIC_API_KEY answer <- chat_with_context(   graph,   "Which function calls prepare_data()?",   provider = "anthropic" )

title: Getting Started with rrlmgraph
text: editing source files need rebuild full graph. update_graph_incremental() re-parses changed files:
code: # Simulate editing a file writeLines(c(   "#' Prepare data (updated)",   "#'",   "#' @param raw A data.frame of raw values.",   "#' @param remove_na Logical. Remove rows with NAs. Default TRUE.",   "#' @return A cleaned data.frame.",   "#' @export",   "prepare_data <- function(raw, remove_na = TRUE) {",   "  if (remove_na) raw <- raw[complete.cases(raw), ]",   "  raw",   "}" ), file.path(proj_dir, "R", "data_prep.R"))  graph <- update_graph_incremental(   graph,   changed_files = file.path(proj_dir, "R", "data_prep.R"),   verbose = TRUE ) #>  #> ── Incremental graph update ── #>  #> Changed files: /tmp/Rtmp15UXpI/mypkg_demo/R/data_prep.R #> Re-parsing 1 file(s). #> No new nodes; finalising graph. #> Persisting cache to /tmp/Rtmp15UXpI/mypkg_demo. #> Graph cached at /tmp/Rtmp15UXpI/mypkg_demo/.rrlmgraph  summary(graph) #> IGRAPH ae7fb00 DNW- 0 0 --  #> + attr: project_name (g/c), project_root (g/c), project_type (g/c), #> | r_version (g/c), build_time (g/n), build_at (g/c), embed_method #> | (g/c), embed_model (g/x), cache_path (g/c), name (v/c), node_type #> | (v/c), file (v/c), line_start (v/n), line_end (v/n), signature (v/c), #> | complexity (v/n), pagerank (v/n), embedding (v/x), weight (e/n), #> | edge_type (e/c)

title: Getting Started with rrlmgraph
text: large projects, save built graph avoid re-parsing every session:
code: # Save to <project>/.rrlmgraph/graph.rds save_graph_cache(graph)  # Restore in a later session graph <- load_graph_cache(proj_dir)
